intro: Antrocaryon micraster, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk. It is often found in open grasslands and rocky outcrops, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
